subject: Real Estate
title: Airbnb and the Rental Disruption
description: Learn Airbnb and the Rental Disruption in one minute.

hook.text: In 2007, two designers in San Francisco couldn't make rent. They inflated air mattresses for strangers.

buildup.text: AirBed & Breakfast became Airbnb. By 2023, it listed over 7 million properties worldwide.

discovery.text: Homeowners could now earn hotel-level income from spare rooms without a hospitality license.

twist.text: Cities pushed back. Short-term rentals reduced long-term housing supply and drove up rents.

climax.text: Barcelona, New York, and Tokyo passed laws restricting Airbnb. The platform reshaped urban housing policy.

punchline.text: Air mattresses started a global housing debate.

quiz.question: What problem did Airbnb create in many cities?
